input:
Sophia is a biologist with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 13), my wife (birthday on September 19), my child_1 (birthday on September 06), my father (birthday on July 27), my mother (birthday on June 05), 
2) Attending a fashion week in Paris in week 24-25.

3) Attend a parenting workshop every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 13.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Sophia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_range.24: Attending a fashion week in Paris
checks_range.25: Attending a fashion week in Paris

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year was a whirlwind of activity, with the lab buzzing with the excitement of new projects. I spent most of my time in meetings, discussing the feasibility of our proposed designs with colleagues and stakeholders. The discussions were engaging, and I was impressed by the diverse perspectives and ideas that emerged. Outside of work, we continued to enjoy the winter wonderland that our neighborhood had become. The kids were thrilled to have a snow day on Wednesday, and we made the most of it by building an epic snowman and having a friendly snowball fight. My wife and I also managed to squeeze in a romantic dinner at a cozy Italian restaurant, where we savored delicious pasta and wine. The highlight of the week, however, was the family game night on Friday. We gathered around the living room, surrounded by board games and snacks, and spent the evening laughing and competing with each other. It was a wonderful way to unwind and create memories together.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week was a bit of a challenge, as the cold snap that had been gripping our region showed no signs of letting up. The temperatures plummeted to -10°C, making it difficult to venture out. However, we didn't let the cold stop us from enjoying the winter season. We bundled up and took a family walk through the park, marveling at the frozen lakes and snow-covered trees. The kids were fascinated by the ice formations and spent hours gazing at the frozen beauty. At work, I made significant progress on my design project, finalizing the initial sketches and beginning to explore the technical aspects of the proposal. My wife and I also started making plans for a family vacation, which we hope to take in the spring. We're considering a trip to the mountains, where we can hike and enjoy the great outdoors together. The weekend was a quiet one, with most of our time spent indoors, enjoying hot chocolate and reading books.

Olivia is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 04), my wife (birthday on March 28), my child_1 (birthday on December 09), my father (birthday on June 07), my mother (birthday on May 09), 
2) Exploring the ancient temples of Cambodia in week 15-16.

3) Attend a jazz music appreciation club every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Olivia for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Noah is a photographer with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on March 08), my wife (birthday on July 09), my child_1 (birthday on November 06), my child_2 (birthday on August 31), my child_3 (birthday on November 17), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 6-7.

3) Join a local running club for weekend marathons every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year unfolded with a mix of work and family commitments. My wife and I attended a parent-teacher conference at the kids' school, where we discussed their progress and set goals for the upcoming semester. The kids were excited to share their latest art projects and science experiments, showcasing their creativity and curiosity. At work, I made significant progress on the new design, refining the concept and exploring potential materials. The lab was abuzz with activity as colleagues shared their findings and insights, fostering a collaborative environment. On the weekend, we hosted a family dinner, inviting my wife's sister and her family over for a hearty meal and lively conversation. The kids enjoyed playing with their cousins, while my wife and I caught up with our sister-in-law, discussing everything from our careers to our favorite TV shows. The evening ended with a cozy movie night, snuggled up under blankets with hot chocolate in hand.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
This week was marked by a series of milestones and celebrations. My wife's birthday was on the 17th, and we planned a surprise party for her at home. The kids helped decorate the living room with balloons and streamers, while I prepared a special birthday dinner. My wife was touched by the thoughtful gestures and enjoyed the evening with our family and close friends. At work, I presented my design concept to the team, receiving positive feedback and suggestions for improvement. The lab was filled with the sound of brainstorming and idea-sharing, as we worked together to refine the design. On the weekend, we took a family hike, exploring the nearby trails and enjoying the crisp winter air. The kids were fascinated by the snow-covered trees and the sound of birds chirping in the distance. As we walked, we discussed our goals and aspirations, reflecting on the progress we've made so far in the year.

The kids enjoyed playing with their friends, while my wife and I caught up with our friends, discussing everything from our careers to our favorite books.

The kids were fascinated by the art and history on display, while my wife and I enjoyed the cultural experience and the opportunity to spend quality time together.

input:
Noah is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 22), my wife (birthday on September 03), my child_1 (birthday on March 21), my father (birthday on February 16), my mother (birthday on February 04), 
2) Week-long road trip across the Pacific Coast Highway in week 27-28.

3) Join a historical walking tour of the city every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 14.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Noah for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year was a whirlwind of activity, with the lab buzzing with the excitement of new projects. I spent most of my time working on the energy efficiency design, pouring over research papers and conducting experiments to test its feasibility. The results were promising, and I'm eager to see how it will perform in real-world conditions. At home, we continued to enjoy the quiet of the post-holiday period, using the time to recharge and refocus. The kids are back in school, and we're settling into a new routine. My wife and I have been discussing our plans for the year, including a potential family vacation to the beach. We're also thinking about taking a cooking class together, something we've been wanting to do for a while. The weather this week was a bit more unpredictable, with a mix of rain and sunshine. We took advantage of the rain to do some indoor activities, like baking and playing board games. The sunshine, on the other hand, brought us outside for a family bike ride and a picnic in the park. Overall, the week was a great balance of work, family, and fun.

input:
Benjamin is a chef with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on July 03), my wife (birthday on December 20), my child_1 (birthday on November 30), my child_2 (birthday on September 29), my child_3 (birthday on January 15), 
2) Participating in a desert trek in Morocco in week 51-52.

3) Explore new cafes and restaurants every 3 weeks on weekends, starting from week 10.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

input:
Benjamin is a architect with a passion for chronicling his vibrant life through weekly diary entries. Captures:
1) Family member birthday: husband (yourself) (birthday on May 14), my wife (birthday on January 19), my child_1 (birthday on January 01), my child_2 (birthday on March 16), my father (birthday on December 06), 
2) Joining a fitness and wellness retreat in Bali in week 32-33.

3) Attend DIY home improvement workshops every 5 weeks on weekends, starting from week 15.
 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.
5) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly entry (e.g. #*# Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)
Generate a complete weekly diary for Benjamin for the entire year of 2018. Start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week. Each diary entry should be at least 200 words. When the design of all 52 weeks is complete, use '*** finished ***' to indicate the end of the document. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
The second week of the year unfolded with a mix of work and play. In the lab, we delved deeper into the design of our new energy-efficient building concept. The team's collective creativity and expertise are yielding promising results. I spent a few hours researching sustainable materials and innovative construction techniques that could further enhance our design. On the personal front, my wife and I started a new exercise routine, aiming to get in shape for the upcoming fitness retreat in Bali. We've been enjoying our early morning jogs and yoga sessions, finding it a great way to bond and set a healthy tone for the year. The kids are back in school, and we're adjusting to the new routine. They're keeping us on our toes with their boundless energy and curiosity. This week, we also started a new family tradition – a weekly dinner where we share stories and discuss our experiences. It's been a wonderful way to connect and strengthen our relationships. As for the weekend, we took a short trip to the nearby city to explore some local art galleries and museums. The kids were fascinated by the exhibits, and we enjoyed the cultural outing together.

 Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
The third week of the year brought a welcome change in the weather. The frosty mornings gave way to milder temperatures, and the sun shone brightly, casting a warm glow over our neighborhood. In the lab, we made significant progress on our energy-efficient building design. The team's hard work and dedication are paying off, and we're excited to share our findings with the rest of the company. On the personal front, my wife and I continued our exercise routine, gradually increasing the intensity and duration of our workouts. We're feeling more energized and focused, and our morning jogs are becoming a highlight of our day. The kids are thriving in school, and we're proud of their progress. This week, we also started a new project at home – a DIY home improvement workshop. We're planning to renovate our living room, and we're excited to get our hands dirty and learn new skills. As for the weekend, we spent some quality time with our friends, hosting a dinner party and enjoying each other's company.

 Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
The fourth week of the year was a busy one, with multiple projects underway in the lab and at home. The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year.

 4) Weekly updates on weather changes, work developments, family life, and other interesting topics.

The New Year dawned frosty and bright, with temperatures stubbornly clinging to a cool 5°C. The cold didn't deter us from our annual New Year's walk through the nearby park, a tradition that helps us set our intentions for the year ahead. Wrapped in our warmest coats, my wife and I discussed our personal and professional goals for 2018, making plans to nurture both our careers and our family. Back at work this week, the atmosphere in the engineering lab was charged with fresh energy and enthusiasm. The new projects on the horizon promise challenging and innovative solutions that could redefine our approaches. I spent the first few days sketching out the initial phases of a new design that could potentially improve energy efficiency in urban buildings. At home, the post-holiday transition was smooth. We spent the evenings savoring the quiet after the festive buzz, gradually taking down the Christmas decorations. However, we decided to keep some twinkling lights around the living room; their soft glow brings a cozy cheer to the long winter nights. This week also marked the return to school for the kids. They shared stories of their holiday adventures with friends, buzzing with excitement and a bit of holiday hangover. As for the weekend, it brought a gentle snowfall that transformed our neighborhood into a serene winter landscape, perfect for some impromptu snowball fights and hot chocolate by the fireplace. Overall, the week was a blend of reflection, planning, and familial warmth, setting a hopeful tone for the new year)

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 51 for graphic design studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 55 for music school use.
  - Designate Floor 7 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 35 for small cinema use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 63 to 67 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 19 for pharmacy use.
  - Designate Floor 74 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 99 for yoga studio use.
  - Designate Floor 10 for daycare center use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for photography studio use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 33 for a hospital with various departments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 9 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 13 for martial arts dojo use.
  - Designate Floor 12 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 48 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 23 for art gallery use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 79 to 83 for a corporate headquarters for a major company.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a restaurant every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

checks_range.79: corporate headquarters for a major company
checks_range.80: corporate headquarters for a major company
checks_range.81: corporate headquarters for a major company
checks_range.82: corporate headquarters for a major company
checks_range.83: corporate headquarters for a major company

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for real estate agency use.
  - Designate Floor 77 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 71 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for veterinary clinic use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for retail store use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 3 to 9 for a advanced technology and research institute.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 30 floors, starting from Floor 50
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 32 for photography studio use.
  - Designate Floor 40 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 15 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 94 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 52 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 72 to 77 for a extensive fitness and recreational gym.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 81 for small cinema use.
  - Designate Floor 34 for tailor and custom dressmaking use.
  - Designate Floor 96 for language school use.
  - Designate Floor 47 for graphic design studio use.
  - Designate Floor 90 for office use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 33 to 38 for a luxury residential apartments.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a sky garden every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.

1) Specific floors requirements:

2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 9 to 15 for a comprehensive library with study areas and archives.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a outdoor terrace every 20 floors, starting from Floor 40
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 31 for jewelry workshop use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for conference room use.
  - Designate Floor 50 for retail store use.
  - Designate Floor 18 for legal services use.
  - Designate Floor 26 for spa and wellness center use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 28 to 34 for a multi-theater cinema complex.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a dining area every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

Construct a skyscraper with 100 floors. Please follow the detailed floor assignments below:
1) Specific floors requirements:
  - Designate Floor 61 for accounting firm use.
  - Designate Floor 80 for baking and culinary school use.
  - Designate Floor 49 for boutique use.
  - Designate Floor 36 for office use.
  - Designate Floor 19 for library use.
2) Range floors requirements: Allocate Floors 61 to 67 for a comprehensive library with study areas and archives.
3) Periodic floors requirements: Include a observatory every 15 floors, starting from Floor 35
4) Document each floor independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.
5) Use '#*#' to separate the documentation for each floor (e.g. #*# Floor 1: 
This entry-level floor serves as the primary lobby and reception area of the skyscraper, designed to provide a welcoming and sophisticated entrance. Here are the detailed features: 1) Atrium and Ceiling: The lobby boasts a grand atrium with a towering ceiling that enhances the sense of openness. An elegant, modern chandelier hangs centrally, casting a soft, ambient light that illuminates the space effectively. 2) Reception Area: At the heart of the lobby, the reception desk is crafted from polished marble, presenting a sleek and professional appearance. Staff at the reception are well-equipped to assist visitors and employees. 3) Seating Arrangements: Surrounding the reception are multiple seating areas, featuring contemporary sofas and armchairs that offer comfort and style. These areas are ideal for informal meetings or waiting guests. These elements come together to create an impressive first impression for anyone entering the skyscraper, ensuring functionality meets style right from the entrance.).
 Ensure that the document consists of 100 entries, each containing at least 150 words. Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the narrative throughout the document. When the design of all 100 floors is complete, use '*** finished' to indicate the end of the document. *** started ***
#*# Floor 1:

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 05-13 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
1.4 Celebrate 'April Fool's Surprise Menu' on 04-01 with a special dish: Mystery Dish.
1.5 Celebrate 'Restaurant's 10th Anniversary' on 09-19 with a special dish: Champagne and Caviar.
2) Feature 'Game Meat Fortnight' from Week 26 to Week 28 with dishes like: Venison Steaks.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 12, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***
#*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th):

checks_once.3: Midsummer Night's Feast featuring Grilled Salmon
checks_once.19: Winter Solstice Feast featuring Venison Stew
checks_once.4: Australia Day BBQ featuring Lamb Chops

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on fresh flavors and vibrant colors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes paired with creamy burrata cheese and basil. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Char-grilled octopus served with a zesty lemon-herb sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops: Scallops seared to perfection, served with a citrus-herb butter sauce. 
2.2) Grilled Filet Mignon: Tender filet mignon grilled to desired doneness, served with a rich demiglace. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Fresh asparagus roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
3.2) Saffron Risotto: Creamy risotto infused with saffron and parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with lemon zest and lavender. 
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy tart filled with a mix of fresh berries. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Fruit Spritzers: A refreshing mix of sparkling water and fresh fruit juices. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A soothing blend of herbal tea served over ice. 
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 01-21 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Smoked Salmon Canapés: Smoked salmon served on toasted bagels with cream cheese and capers. 
1.2) Steamed Mussels: Fresh mussels steamed in a white wine and garlic broth. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Salmon: Fresh salmon grilled to perfection, served with a lemon-dill sauce. 
2.2) Roasted Chicken: Tender chicken roasted to perfection, served with a rich gravy. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes: Potatoes roasted with garlic and herbs, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
3.2) Steamed Broccoli: Fresh broccoli steamed to perfection, served with a pat of butter. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich chocolate. 
4.2) Vanilla Bean Crème Brûlée: A creamy crème brûlée infused with vanilla bean and topped with caramelized sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Lemonade: A refreshing mix of lemon juice and sparkling water. 
5.2) Iced Tea with Lemon: A soothing blend of herbal tea served over ice with a squeeze of lemon. 
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on comfort food and hearty flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Tomato Soup: A rich and creamy soup made with fresh tomatoes and basil. 
1.2) Fried Calamari: Crispy fried squid rings served with a tangy marinara sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast: Chicken breast seared to perfection, served with a creamy mushroom sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes infused with garlic and herbs. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Fresh Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of balsamic glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic dessert made with tender apples and a crunchy oat topping. 
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Freshly baked cookies filled with semi-sweet chocolate chips. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Fresh Fruit Smoothie: A refreshing blend of fresh fruit and yogurt.

input:
As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 02-02 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.4 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-11 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.5 Celebrate 'Australia Day BBQ' on 01-26 with a special dish: Lamb Chops.
2) Feature 'Seafood Season Extravaganza' from Week 32 to Week 35 with dishes like: Fresh Seafood Platter.
3) Include 'Burger Mondays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 21, serving: Gourmet Burgers.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh herbs and served with crackers. 
1.2) Spinach and Artichoke Dip: A creamy dip made with spinach, artichoke hearts, and Parmesan cheese, served with crudités. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast: Chicken breast seared to perfection and served with a side of roasted vegetables. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and lemon until tender and caramelized. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: A rich and creamy polenta served with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Cheesecake: A classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and topped with a mixed berry compote. 
4.2) Crème Brûlée: Rich custard base topped with a layer of caramelized sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea infused with fruits and herbs. 
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the New Year with a focus on international flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with shrimp, vegetables, and served with a sweet chili sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: A Cypriot cheese grilled to perfection and served with a side of honey and thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Marinated chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato sauce, served with basmati rice. 
2.2) Beef Fajitas: Sizzling beef strips cooked with bell peppers and onions, served with warm flour tortillas. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Aromatic saffron-infused rice cooked with cardamom and cinnamon. 
3.2) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted with cumin and coriander until tender and caramelized. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern pastry made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Tres Leches Cake: A moist sponge cake soaked in three types of milk (evaporated milk, condensed milk, and heavy cream). 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing yogurt-based drink infused with mango puree and spices. 
5.2) Chai Tea: A spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of warming spices. 
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We continue the international flavors with a focus on Asian cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Edamame Dumplings: Steamed dumplings filled with edamame and served with a side of soy sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Shrimp Skewers: Shrimp marinated in a mixture of soy sauce, honey, and ginger, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Kung Pao Chicken: Stir-fried chicken cooked with peanuts, vegetables, and chili peppers in a savory sauce. 
2.2) Beef and Broccoli Stir-Fry: Stir-fried beef and broccoli cooked in a mixture of soy sauce, oyster sauce, and hoisin sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Fried Wontons: Crispy fried wontons served with a side of sweet chili sauce. 
3.2) Steamed Bok Choy: Bok choy steamed with garlic and ginger until tender and flavorful. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Mochi Ice Cream: A Japanese-style ice cream sandwich made with mochi and green tea ice cream. 
4.2) Coconut Rice Pudding: A creamy rice pudding infused with coconut milk and topped with toasted coconut flakes. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Lychee Martini: A refreshing cocktail made with lychee liqueur, vodka, and a splash of lemon juice. 
5.2) Green Tea: A soothing green tea infused with jasmine and lemon. 
 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th): 
We welcome the fifth week of the New Year with a focus on comfort food. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Fried Chicken Tenders: Crispy fried chicken tenders served with a side of honey mustard sauce. 
1.2) Mac and Cheese Bites: Breaded and fried macaroni and cheese bites served with a side of marinara sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Meatloaf: A classic meatloaf made with ground beef, pork, and topped with a ketchup glaze. 
2.2) Chicken Pot Pie: A savory pie filled with chicken, vegetables, and topped with a flaky crust.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Midsummer Night's Feast' on 03-28 with a special dish: Grilled Salmon.
1.2 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
1.3 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.4 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 12-09 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.5 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
2) Feature 'Winter Delicacies' from Week 17 to Week 18 with dishes like: Braised Game Meats.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on seasonal ingredients and bold flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes paired with creamy burrata cheese and basil. 
1.2) Pan-Seared Scallops: Succulent scallops seared to perfection, served with a zesty lemon butter sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Filet Mignon: Tender filet mignon grilled to perfection, served with a rich demiglace. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Cod: Flaky cod pan-seared with a crispy crust, served with a side of tartar sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Fresh asparagus roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of olive oil. 
3.2) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked to a perfect fluff. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A rich lemon and lavender-infused creme brûlée topped with a caramelized sugar crust. 
4.2) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy mix of fresh fruits atop a buttery pastry crust. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the bold flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Fresh Juices: A refreshing blend of seasonal juices to cleanse the palate.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the New Year with a focus on comfort food and hearty portions. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Broccoli Soup: A rich and creamy broccoli soup served with a swirl of crème fraîche. 
1.2) Crispy Fried Calamari: Crispy fried squid rings served with a side of tangy marinara sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken Breast: Tender chicken breast pan-seared with a crispy crust, served with a side of creamy mashed potatoes. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic and Herb Roasted Potatoes: Crispy roasted potatoes infused with garlic and herbs. 
3.2) Steamed Green Beans: Fresh green beans steamed to perfection, finished with a squeeze of lemon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic apple crisp topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. 
4.2) Chocolate Chip Cookies: Freshly baked chocolate chip cookies served warm and gooey. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing blend of iced tea to pair with the comforting flavors of the meals.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We celebrate the midpoint of the month with a focus on international flavors and spices. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spicy Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in a zesty mixture of lime juice, mixed with diced mango and red onion. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi Cheese: Cypriot halloumi cheese grilled to perfection, served with a side of honey and thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Tender chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based sauce, served with basmati rice. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Flaky salmon pan-seared with a crispy crust, served with a side of lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron-Infused Basmati Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused basmati rice cooked to a perfect fluff. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Fresh Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of balsamic glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Cardamom and Rosewater Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with the warm spices of cardamom and rosewater. 
4.2) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern pastry made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing blend of yogurt, mango, and spices to pair with the international flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Chai Tea: A spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of warming spices.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

2. Main Courses:

2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes:
