Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Veganuary Special' on 05-14 with a special dish: Vegan Mushroom Risotto.
1.2 Celebrate 'Saint Patrick's Day' on 03-17 with a special dish: Irish Stew.
1.3 Celebrate 'Pancake Day Treat' on 02-13 with a special dish: Blueberry Pancakes.
1.4 Celebrate 'Easter Brunch' on 04-01 with a special dish: Spring Lamb Roast.
1.5 Celebrate 'Spring Equinox Celebration' on 01-19 with a special dish: Wild Garlic Pesto Pasta.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 10 to Week 13 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.
3) Include 'Sushi Saturdays' every 4 weeks starting from Week 11, serving: Assorted Sushi Platter.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes that warm the soul. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie and Fresh Fruit: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh fruit and served with crackers. 
1.2) Spicy Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in a zesty mixture of lime juice, mixed with diced mango and red onion. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich, full-bodied red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection, served with a side of lemon butter and herbs. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Root Vegetables: A medley of root vegetables roasted to perfection, tossed with olive oil and herbs. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: Smooth polenta cooked with heavy cream and Parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Warm Apple Crisp: A classic dessert featuring tender apples topped with a crunchy oat and brown sugar topping. 
4.2) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with the sweetness of lemon and the subtlety of lavender. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the bold flavors of the dishes. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: Rich, velvety hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the New Year with a focus on international flavors and spices. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Grilled Halloumi: Cypriot cheese grilled to perfection, served with a side of honey and thyme. 
1.2) Spicy Tuna Tartare: Fresh tuna mixed with diced mango and red onion, served with crispy wonton chips. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tagine: Moroccan-inspired chicken stew cooked with aromatic spices and dried fruits. 
2.2) Korean-Style BBQ Beef: Marinated beef short ribs grilled to perfection, served with a side of kimchi and steamed rice. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked with chicken broth and toasted almonds. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection, tossed with olive oil and crispy bacon. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert featuring layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Coconut Rice Pudding: Creamy rice pudding infused with the sweetness of coconut and the subtlety of cardamom. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) International Wines: A selection of wines from around the world, carefully curated to pair with the international flavors. 
5.2) Chai Tea: Spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of warming spices. 

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We celebrate the fourth week of the New Year with a focus on seasonal ingredients and farm-to-table cuisine. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes mixed with burrata cheese, basil, and a drizzle of balsamic glaze. 
1.2) Roasted Beet Tartine: Roasted beets topped with goat cheese, walnuts, and a sprinkle of thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops: Fresh scallops seared to perfection, served with a side of lemon butter and microgreens. 
2.2) Grilled Lamb Chops: Tender lamb chops grilled to perfection, served with a side of roasted vegetables and tzatziki sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Carrots: Carrots roasted to perfection, tossed with olive oil and a sprinkle of cumin. 
3.2) Sautéed Spinach: Fresh spinach sautéed with garlic and lemon, served with a sprinkle of red pepper flakes. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Creme Brûlée: A rich creme brûlée infused with the sweetness of lemon and the subtlety of lavender. 
4.2) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in rich, dark chocolate and served with a sprinkle of sea salt. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Cocktails: A selection of craft cocktails made with seasonal ingredients and house-made mixers. 
5.2) Fresh-Squeezed Juice: Freshly squeezed juice made with seasonal fruits and vegetables. 

 Menu Week 5 (January 29th - February 4th):

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Independence Day Celebration' on 07-04 with a special dish: American Apple Pie.
1.2 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
1.3 Celebrate 'Winter Solstice Feast' on 02-07 with a special dish: Venison Stew.
1.4 Celebrate 'Oktoberfest Beer Dinner' on 10-06 with a special dish: Sausages and Sauerkraut.
1.5 Celebrate 'Valentine's Day Special' on 02-14 with a special dish: Heart-Shaped Red Velvet Cake.
2) Feature 'Cherry Blossom Festival Dishes' from Week 7 to Week 9 with dishes like: Cherry Blossom Tea and Sweets.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 2, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

output_blocks:
Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on seasonal ingredients and bold flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Heirloom Tomato Salad: Fresh heirloom tomatoes paired with burrata cheese and basil, dressed with a balsamic vinaigrette. 
1.2) Grilled Octopus: Char-grilled octopus served with a smoky aioli and microgreens. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Pan-Seared Scallops: Scallops seared to perfection, served with a lemon-caper sauce and microgreens. 
2.2) Grilled Wagyu Beef: Wagyu beef grilled to desired doneness, served with a rich demiglace. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Asparagus: Asparagus roasted to perfection, finished with a squeeze of lemon. 
3.2) Saffron Risotto: Creamy risotto infused with saffron and parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Lemon Lavender Panna Cotta: A creamy panna cotta infused with lemon zest and lavender, topped with fresh berries. 
4.2) Chocolate Soufflé: A rich, decadent chocolate soufflé served with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the bold flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Fresh Juices: Freshly squeezed juices made with seasonal fruits and vegetables. 
 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We welcome the third week of the New Year with a focus on comfort food and hearty portions. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Broccoli Soup: A rich and creamy broccoli soup served with a swirl of creme fraiche. 
1.2) Fried Calamari: Crispy fried calamari served with a tangy marinara sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich demiglace. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken: Chicken breast seared to perfection, served with a creamy mushroom sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of balsamic glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Apple Crisp: A warm and comforting apple crisp topped with a crunchy oat topping. 
4.2) Cheesecake: A classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and a mixed berry compote. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing iced tea infused with seasonal fruits and herbs. 
 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We celebrate the fourth week of the New Year with a focus on international flavors and spices. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spicy Shrimp Ceviche: Fresh shrimp marinated in a spicy mixture of lime juice and mixed with diced mango and red onion. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: Grilled halloumi cheese served with a drizzle of honey and a sprinkle of thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Chicken breast marinated in a blend of Indian spices and yogurt, served in a rich tomato sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Salmon fillet seared to perfection, served with a lemon-dill sauce and microgreens. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: Fragrant saffron-infused rice cooked with cardamom and cinnamon. 
3.2) Roasted Sweet Potatoes: Sweet potatoes roasted to perfection, finished with a drizzle of harissa. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A classic Middle Eastern dessert made with layers of phyllo, nuts, and honey. 
4.2) Coconut Rice Pudding: A creamy rice pudding infused with coconut milk and topped with toasted almonds. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Mango Lassi: A refreshing yogurt-based drink infused with mango puree and spices. 
5.2) Chai Tea: A spiced tea made with black tea, milk, and a blend of warming spices.

 Menu Week 22 (May 28th - June 3rd):

 Menu Week 24 (June 11th - June 17th):

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

As Chef Roy Hee, a world-renowned chef at a globally renowned restaurant, you are tasked with designing an entire year's menu for 2018. Your menu should be varied and innovative, adhering to the following guidelines:
1): 1.1 Celebrate 'Mid-Autumn Festival' on 09-24 with a special dish: Mooncakes.
1.2 Celebrate 'Cinco de Mayo Fiesta' on 05-05 with a special dish: Tacos Al Pastor.
1.3 Celebrate 'Summer Solstice Celebration' on 04-06 with a special dish: Midsummer Night's Fish Fry.
1.4 Celebrate 'Labor Day BBQ' on 05-01 with a special dish: Grilled Steak.
1.5 Celebrate 'Father's Day Feast' on 06-17 with a special dish: Barbecued Ribs.
2) Feature 'Mushroom Season Specials' from Week 22 to Week 25 with dishes like: Various Mushroom Dishes.
3) Include 'Soup and Salad Midweek' every 2 weeks starting from Week 3, serving: Seasonal Soup and Salad.
4) Use '#*#' to separate each weekly menu (e.g. #*# Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 1. Appetizers: 1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 2. Main Courses: 2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 3. Side Dishes: 3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 4. Desserts: 4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 5. Drinks: 5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.)
Generate a comprehensive weekly menu diary for the entire year of 2018, start from January 1st, a Monday, marking the first week, and continue through to December 31st, the end of the 52nd week. Ensure that the diary consists of 52 entries, one for each week.
- Each weekly menu must include a detailed description of the offerings, featuring at least two options for appetizers, main courses, side dishes, desserts, and drinks. Aim for between 200 and 220 words per menu description to ensure thoroughness and richness of detail.
- Conclude the diary with '*** finished' to signify the completion of the year's menu planning.
- Ensure clarity and continuity without any interruptions or omissions in the menu throughout the year. *** started ***

Menu Week 1 (January 1st - January 7th): 
We kick off the New Year with a celebratory feast that embodies luxury and comfort. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Creamy Shrimp Cocktail: Fresh shrimp served in a homemade cocktail sauce, topped with a dollop of cream. 
1.2) Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a garlic herb cheese mixture, baked until golden. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Lobster Thermidor: Lobster meat cooked with egg yolks and brandy, served in its shell. 
2.2) Roasted Duck with Orange Sauce: Tender duck roasted to perfection, glazed with a citrusy orange sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Garlic Mashed Potatoes: Creamy mashed potatoes enriched with roasted garlic. 
3.2) Glazed Carrots: Carrots cooked until tender and finished with a sweet glaze. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Chocolate Mousse: A rich, silky chocolate mousse topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Tiramisu: Classic Italian dessert with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cheese. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fine Wines: A selection of red and white wines curated to complement the flavors of the meals. 
5.2) Champagne: Sparkling champagne to celebrate the new beginnings. 
This week's menu sets the tone for a year of gourmet experiences, starting with dishes that combine classic techniques with festive flavors.

 Menu Week 2 (January 8th - January 14th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on hearty, comforting dishes. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Baked Brie: A wheel of brie cheese baked with fresh herbs and served with crackers. 
1.2) Spicy Meatballs: Mini meatballs made with a blend of beef and pork, served in a spicy tomato sauce. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Braised Short Ribs: Fall-off-the-bone tender short ribs slow-cooked in a rich red wine sauce. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Salmon: Fresh salmon fillet seared to perfection and served with a lemon butter sauce. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Roasted Brussels Sprouts: Brussels sprouts roasted with garlic and lemon until tender and caramelized. 
3.2) Creamy Polenta: A rich and creamy polenta served with a sprinkle of parmesan cheese. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Cheesecake: A classic cheesecake with a graham cracker crust and topped with a mixed berry compote. 
4.2) Crème Brûlée: Rich custard base topped with a layer of caramelized sugar. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Craft Beers: A selection of craft beers to pair with the bold flavors of the dishes. 
5.2) Hot Chocolate: A rich and creamy hot chocolate made with dark chocolate and topped with whipped cream.

 Menu Week 3 (January 15th - January 21st): 
We introduce a new feature, 'Soup and Salad Midweek', every 2 weeks starting from this week. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Fried Calamari: Crispy fried squid rings served with a tangy marinara sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Shrimp Skewers: Shrimp marinated in a mixture of olive oil, garlic, and herbs, grilled to perfection. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Grilled Steak: A tender cut of steak grilled to perfection and served with a side of roasted vegetables. 
2.2) Pan-Seared Chicken: Chicken breast seared to perfection and served with a side of creamy mashed potatoes. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Seasonal Soup: Creamy tomato soup made with fresh tomatoes and basil. 
3.2) Mixed Greens Salad: A fresh mix of greens, cherry tomatoes, and cucumber, topped with a balsamic vinaigrette. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Fresh Fruit Tart: A sweet and tangy tart made with a mixture of fresh berries and topped with whipped cream. 
4.2) Chocolate-Dipped Strawberries: Fresh strawberries dipped in melted chocolate and served chilled. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) Fresh Juices: A selection of fresh juices made with seasonal fruits. 
5.2) Iced Tea: A refreshing glass of iced tea served sweetened or unsweetened.

 Menu Week 4 (January 22nd - January 28th): 
We continue the celebration of the New Year with a focus on international flavors. 
1. Appetizers: 
1.1) Spring Rolls: Crispy spring rolls filled with a mixture of vegetables and served with a sweet chili sauce. 
1.2) Grilled Halloumi: A Cypriot cheese grilled to perfection and served with a side of honey and thyme. 
2. Main Courses: 
2.1) Chicken Tikka Masala: Chicken marinated in a mixture of yogurt and spices, grilled and served in a rich tomato sauce. 
2.2) Beef Fajitas: Sliced beef cooked with bell peppers and onions, served with warm flour tortillas. 
3. Side Dishes: 
3.1) Saffron Rice: A flavorful rice dish made with saffron and served with a sprinkle of parsley. 
3.2) Roasted Vegetables: A selection of roasted vegetables including carrots, zucchini, and bell peppers. 
4. Desserts: 
4.1) Baklava: A sweet pastry made with layers of phyllo dough and nuts, topped with a honey syrup. 
4.2) Tres Leches Cake: A moist sponge cake soaked in a mixture of three types of milk. 
5. Drinks: 
5.1) International Beers: A selection of beers from around the world to pair with the international flavors. 
5.2) Fresh Limeade: A refreshing glass of limeade made with fresh lime juice and sugar.

3) Periodic block requirements: Include a bus station starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 2 blocks along the column.

  - Designate Block at (1, 7) for hospital use.

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a cultural quarter along the row from (1, 3) to (1, 4).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.

Design a vibrant and diverse city using a 10x10 block grid, numbered from 1 to 100. Arrange the blocks sequentially from left to right and top to bottom. Ensure that each block is uniquely planned to reflect a wide array of city facilities, highlighting the rich urban environment and cultural diversity.1) Specific block requirements:
  - Designate Block at (3, 0) for botanical garden use.
  - Designate Block at (7, 5) for library use.
  - Designate Block at (6, 9) for farm use.
  - Designate Block at (1, 6) for industrial sector use.
  - Designate Block at (4, 7) for botanical garden use.
2) Range block requirements: Allocate a shopping district along the row from (7, 2) to (7, 5).
3) Periodic block requirements: Include a coffee shop starting from Block at (0, 5) with an interval of every 4 blocks along the column.
4) Document each block independently with detailed descriptions of the intended facilities, architectural features, and unique design elements.

2) Range block requirements: Allocate a business district along the row from (5, 4) to (5, 7).
